  858: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0"},
  859: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"00.00.00"},
  860: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.00.0.0"},
  861: 	 {{0,0,0,0},"0.0.000000000000.0"}],
  862:     V6Sloppy =
  863:         [{{16#a,16#b,16#c,16#0,16#0,16#d,16#e,16#f},"A:B:C::d:e:f"},
  864:          {{16#fe80,0,0,0,0,0,0,16#12},"fe80::12%XXXXXXX"}]
  865:         ++
  866:         [{{P,0,0,0,0,D2,(D1 bsl 8) bor D2,(D3 bsl 8) bor D4},
  867:           Q++erlang:integer_to_list(D2, 16)++":"++S}
  868:          || {{D1,D2,D3,D4},S} <- V4Reversable,
  869:             {P,Q} <-
  870:                 [{16#2001,"2001::"},{16#177,"177::"},{16#ff0,"Ff0::"}]],
  871:     V4Err =
  872: 	["0.256.0.1",
  873: 	 "1.2.3.4.5",
  874: 	 "256.255.65535",
  875: 	 "4294967296",
  876: 	 "0x100000000",
  877: 	 "040000000000",
  878: 	 "1.2.3.-4",
  879: 	 "1.2.-3.4",
  880: 	 "1.-2.3.4",
  881: 	 "-1.2.3.4",
  882: 	 "10.",
  883: 	 "172.16.",
  884: 	 "198.168.0.",
  885: 	 "127.0.0.1."],
  886:     V6Err =
  887: 	[":::",
  888: 	 "f:::2",
  889: 	 "::-1",
  890: 	 "::g",
  891: 	 "f:f11::10100:2",
  892: 	 "f:f11::01100:2",
  893: 	 "::17000",
  894: 	 "::01700",
  895: 	 "10000::",
  896: 	 "01000::",
  897: 	 "::8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1",
  898: 	 "8:7:6:5:4:3:2:1::",
  899: 	 "8:7:6:5:4::3:2:1",
  900: 	 "::1.2.3.4.5",
  901: 	 "::1.2.3.04",
  902: 	 "::1.256.3.4",
  903: 	 "::-5.4.3.2",
  904: 	 "::5.-4.3.2",
  905: 	 "::5.4.-3.2",
  906: 	 "::5.4.3.-2",
  907: 	 "::FFFF:1.2.3.4.5",
  908: 	 "::10.",
  909: 	 "::FFFF:172.16.",
  910: 	 "fe80::198.168.0.",
  911: 	 "fec0::fFfF:127.0.0.1."],
  912:     t_parse_address
  913:       (parse_ipv6_address,
  914:        false,
  915:        V6Reversable++V6Sloppy++V6Err++V4Err),
  916:     t_parse_address
  917:       (parse_ipv6strict_address,
  918:        true,
  919:        V6Reversable++V6Err++V4Err),
  920:     t_parse_address
  921:       (parse_ipv4_address,
  922:        false,
  923:        V4Reversable++V4Sloppy++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V6Reversable]),
  924:     t_parse_address
  925:       (parse_ipv4strict_address,
  926:        true,
  927:        V4Reversable++V4Err++V6Err++[S || {_,S} <- V4Sloppy++V6Reversable]).
  928: 
  929: t_parse_address(Func, _Reversable, []) ->
  930:     io:format("~p done.~n", [Func]),
  931:     ok;
  932: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [{Addr,String}|L]) ->
  933:     io:format("~p = ~p.~n", [Addr,String]),
  934:     {ok,Addr} = inet:Func(String),
  935:     case Reversible of
  936:         true ->String = inet:ntoa(Addr);
  937:         false -> ok
  938:     end,
  939:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L);
  940: t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, [String|L]) ->
  941:     io:format("~p.~n", [String]),
  942:     {error,einval} = inet:Func(String),
  943:     t_parse_address(Func, Reversible, L).
  944: 
  945: parse_strict_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  946:     {ok, {127,0,0,1}} =
  947: 	inet:parse_strict_address("127.0.0.1"),
  948:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,21952,50796,119,136}} =
  949: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440:55c0:c66c:77:0088"),
  950:     {ok, {3089,3106,23603,50240,0,0,119,136}} =
  951: 	inet:parse_strict_address("c11:0c22:5c33:c440::077:0088").
  952: 
  953: is_ip_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  954:     IPv4Addresses = [
  955:         {0, 0, 0, 0},
  956:         {255, 255, 255, 255}
  957:     ],
  958:     IPv6Addresses = [
  959:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  960:         {16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff, 16#ffff}
  961:     ],
  962:     NonIPAddresses = [
  963:         foo,
  964:         "0.0.0.0",
  965:         {},
  966:         {0},
  967:         {0, 0},
  968:         {0, 0, 0},
  969:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  970:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  971:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  972:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  973:         {0, 0, 0, foo},
  974:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, foo},
  975:         {0, 0, 0, 256},
  976:         {0, 0, 256, 0},
  977:         {0, 256, 0, 0},
  978:         {256, 0, 0, 0},
  979:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000},
  980:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0},
  981:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0},
  982:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0},
  983:         {0, 0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  984:         {0, 0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  985:         {0, 16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  986:         {16#10000, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  987:         {0, 0, 0, -1},
  988:         {0, 0, -1, 0},
  989:         {0, -1, 0, 0},
  990:         {-1, 0, 0, 0},
  991:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1},
  992:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0},
  993:         {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0},
  994:         {0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0},
  995:         {0, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  996:         {0, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  997:         {0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},
  998:         {-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}
  999:     ],
 1000: 
 1001:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv4Addresses),
 1002:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv4_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
 1003: 
 1004:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv6Addresses),
 1005:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ipv6_address/1, IPv4Addresses ++ NonIPAddresses),
 1006: 
 1007:     true = lists:all(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, IPv6Addresses ++ IPv4Addresses),
 1008:     false = lists:any(fun inet:is_ip_address/1, NonIPAddresses).
 1009: 
 1010: ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1011:     {D1,D2,D3,D4} = IPv4Address =
 1012:         {rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1013:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1014:          rand:uniform(256) - 1,
 1015:          rand:uniform(256) - 1},
 1016:     E7 = (D1 bsl 8) bor D2,
 1017:     E8 = (D3 bsl 8) bor D4,
 1018:     io:format("IPv4Address: ~p.~n", [IPv4Address]),
 1019:     {0,0,0,0,0,65535,E7,E8} = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv4Address),
 1020:     IPv6Address =
 1021:         {rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1022:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1023:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1024:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1025:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1,
 1026:          rand:uniform(65536) - 1, E7, E8},
 1027:     IPv4Address = inet:ipv4_mapped_ipv6_address(IPv6Address),
 1028:     ok.
 1029: 
 1030: 
 1031: ntoa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1032:     M8 = 1 bsl 8,
 1033:     M16 = 1 bsl 16,
 1034:     V4Xs = rand_tuple(4, M8),
 1035:     V6Xs = rand_tuple(4, M16),
 1036:     ntoa(
 1037:       [{A, B, C, D} ||
 1038:           A <- [0, element(1, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1039:           B <- [0, element(2, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1040:           C <- [0, element(3, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256],
 1041:           D <- [0, element(4, V4Xs), M8-1, -1, 256]], M8-1),
 1042:     ntoa(
 1043:       [{E, F, G, H, G, G, E, F} ||
 1044:           E <- [0, element(1, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1045:           F <- [0, element(2, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1046:           G <- [0, element(3, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16],
 1047:           H <- [0, element(4, V6Xs), M16-1, -1, M16]], M16-1).
 1048: 
 1049: ntoa([A | As], Max) ->
 1050:     case
 1051:         lists:all(
 1052:           fun (X) when 0 =< X, X =< Max -> true;
 1053:               (_) -> false
 1054:           end, tuple_to_list(A))
 1055:     of
 1056:         true ->
 1057:             S = inet:ntoa(A),
 1058:             {ok, A} = inet:parse_address(S);
 1059:         false ->
 1060:             {error, einval} = inet:ntoa(A)
 1061:     end,
 1062:     ntoa(As, Max);
 1063: ntoa([], _Max) ->
 1064:     ok.
 1065: 
 1066: rand_tuple(N, M) ->
 1067:     rand_tuple(N, M, []).
 1068: %%
 1069: rand_tuple(0, _M, Acc) ->
 1070:     list_to_tuple(Acc);
 1071: rand_tuple(N, M, Acc) ->
 1072:     rand_tuple(N - 1, M, [rand:uniform(M) - 1 | Acc]).
 1073: 
 1074: 
 1075: t_gethostnative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1076:     %% this will result in 26 bytes sent which causes problem in Windows
 1077:     %% if the port-program has not assured stdin to be read in BINARY mode
 1078:     %% OTP-2555
 1079:     case inet_gethost_native:gethostbyname(
 1080: 	   "a23456789012345678901234") of
 1081: 	{error,notfound} ->
 1082: 	    ok;
 1083: 	{error,no_data} ->
 1084: 	    ok;
 1085: 	{error,try_again} ->
 1086: 	    ok
 1087:     end.
 1088: 
 1089: %% Check that the emulator survives crashes in gethost_native.
 1090: gethostnative_parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1091:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1092:     {ok,_} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1093:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1094: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1095: 	    do_gethostnative_parallell();
 1096: 	_ ->
 1097: 	    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1098:     end.
 1099: 
 1100: do_gethostnative_parallell() ->
 1101:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1102:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, parallell_gethost, []),
 1103:     receive after 10000 -> ok end,
 1104:     pong = net_adm:ping(Node),
 1105:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1106:     ok.
 1107: 
 1108: parallell_gethost() ->
 1109:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1110:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1111:     parallell_gethost_loop(10, Hostname).
 1112: 
 1113: parallell_gethost_loop(0, _) -> ok;
 1114: parallell_gethost_loop(N, Hostname) ->
 1115:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1116: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1117: 	    true = exit(Pid,kill);
 1118: 	_ ->
 1119: 	    ok
 1120:     end,
 1121: 
 1122:     L = spawn_gethosters(Hostname, 10),
 1123:     release_gethosters(L),
 1124:     collect_gethosters(10),
 1125:     parallell_gethost_loop(N-1, Hostname).
 1126: 
 1127: spawn_gethosters(_, 0) ->
 1128:     [];
 1129: spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N) ->
 1130:     Collector = self(),
 1131:     [spawn(fun() ->
 1132: 		   receive 
 1133: 		       go ->
 1134: 			   case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1135: 			       {ok,_} ->
 1136: 				   Collector ! ok;
 1137: 			       Else ->
 1138: 				   Collector ! {error,Else}
 1139: 			   end
 1140: 		   end 
 1141: 	   end) | 
 1142:      spawn_gethosters(Hostname, N-1)].
 1143: 
 1144: release_gethosters([]) ->
 1145:     ok;
 1146: release_gethosters([H|T]) ->
 1147:     H ! go,
 1148:     release_gethosters(T).
 1149: 
 1150: collect_gethosters(0) ->
 1151:     ok;
 1152: collect_gethosters(N) ->
 1153:     receive
 1154: 	ok ->
 1155: 	    collect_gethosters(N-1);
 1156: 	Else ->
 1157: 	    {failed, {unexpected, Else}}
 1158:     after 2000 ->
 1159: 	    {failed, {missing, N}}
 1160:     end.
 1161: 
 1162: kill_gethost() ->
 1163:     kill_gethost(20).
 1164: 
 1165: kill_gethost(0) ->
 1166:     ok;
 1167: kill_gethost(N) ->
 1168:     put(kill_gethost_n,N),
 1169:     Pid = wait_for_gethost(10),
 1170:     true = exit(Pid,kill),
 1171:     wait_for_dead_gethost(10),
 1172:     kill_gethost(N-1).
 1173: 
 1174: wait_for_dead_gethost(0) ->
 1175:     exit({not_dead,inet_gethost_native});
 1176: wait_for_dead_gethost(N) ->
 1177:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1178: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1179: 	    receive after 1000 ->
 1180: 			    ok
 1181: 		    end,
 1182: 	    wait_for_dead_gethost(N-1);
 1183: 	undefined ->
 1184: 	    ok
 1185:     end.
 1186: 
 1187: wait_for_gethost(0) ->
 1188:     exit(gethost_not_found);
 1189: wait_for_gethost(N) ->
 1190:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1191:     case (catch inet:gethostbyname(Hostname)) of
 1192: 	{ok,_} ->
 1193: 	    ok;
 1194: 	Otherwise ->
 1195: 	    %% This is what I call an exit tuple :)
 1196: 	    exit({inet,gethostbyname, returned, Otherwise, 'when',
 1197: 		  'N','=',N,'and','hostname','=',Hostname,'and',
 1198: 		  kill_gethost_n,'=',get(kill_gethost_n)})
 1199:     end,
 1200:     case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1201: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1202: 	    Pid;
 1203: 	_ ->
 1204: 	    receive
 1205: 	    after 1000 ->
 1206: 		    ok
 1207: 	    end,
 1208: 	    wait_for_gethost(N-1)
 1209:     end.
 1210: 
 1211: %% Check that the resolver handles a CNAME loop.
 1212: cname_loop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1213:     %% getbyname (hostent_by_domain)
 1214:     ok = inet_db:add_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, ttl, "mydomain.com"),
 1215:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:getbyname("mydomain.com", ?S_A),
 1216:     ok = inet_db:del_rr("mydomain.com", in, ?S_CNAME, "mydomain.com"),
 1217:     %% res_hostent_by_domain
 1218:     RR = #dns_rr{domain = "mydomain.com",
 1219: 		 class = in,
 1220: 		 type = ?S_CNAME,
 1221: 		 data = "mydomain.com"},
 1222:     Rec = #dns_rec{anlist = [RR]},
 1223:     {error,nxdomain} = inet_db:res_hostent_by_domain("mydomain.com", ?S_A, Rec),
 1224:     ok.
 1225: 
 1226: 
 1227: %% Test that hosts file gets reloaded correctly in case when it
 1228: % was missing during initial startup
 1229: missing_hosts_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1230:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1231:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ ".hosts"),
 1232:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "inetrc"),
 1233:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1234:     {error, enoent} = file:read_file_info(HostsFile),
 1235:     % start a node
 1236:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1237:     % ensure it has our RC
 1238:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1239:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1240:     % ensure it does not resolve
 1241:     {error, nxdomain} = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1242:     % write hosts file
 1243:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, "1.2.3.4 somehost"),
 1244:     % wait for cached timestamp to expire
 1245:     timer:sleep(?RES_FILE_UPDATE_TM * 1000 + 100),
 1246:     % ensure it DOES resolve
 1247:     {ok,{hostent,"somehost",[],inet,4,[{1,2,3,4}]}} =
 1248:         rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, ["somehost"]),
 1249:     % cleanup
 1250:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1251: 
 1252: 
 1253: %% The /etc/hosts file format and limitations is quite undocumented.
 1254: %%
 1255: %% Our implementation of the hosts file resolver tries to
 1256: %% do the right thing.  Here is an attempt to define "the right thing",
 1257: %% and this test case tries to check most of these rules:
 1258: %%
 1259: %% * A hosts file consists of entries with one IP address,
 1260: %%   and a list of host names.  The IP address is IPv4 or IPv6.
 1261: %%   The first host name is the primary host name
 1262: %%   and the others are aliases.
 1263: %%
 1264: %% * A lookup for an IP address should return one #hostent{} record
 1265: %%   with the one IP address from the query, and the host names
 1266: %%   from all entries with the same IP address concatenated.
 1267: %%   The first host name from the first hosts file entry
 1268: %%   with the requested IP address will be the primary host name
 1269: %%   and all others are aliases.  All host names are returned
 1270: %%   as in the hosts file entries i.e character case is preserved.
 1271: %%
 1272: %% * A lookup for a host name is character case insensitive.
 1273: %%
 1274: %% * A lookup for a host name should return one #hostent{} record
 1275: %%   with the host name list from the first hosts file entry
 1276: %%   with an IP address of the requested address family
 1277: %%   that has a matching host name, as it is in the hosts file
 1278: %%   i.e character case is preserved.  The IP addresses in the
 1279: %%   returned #hostent{} record should be the first from the
 1280: %%   same matching hosts file entry, followed by all others
 1281: %%   for which there is a matching host name and address family.
 1282: %%   There should be no duplicates among the returned IP addresses.
 1283: %%
 1284: %% * These rules are of the opinion that if duplicate host names
 1285: %%   with the same character casing occurs for the same IP
 1286: %%   address, it is a configuration error, so it is not tested for
 1287: %%   and there is no preferred behaviour.
 1288: hosts_file_quirks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1289:     Records = [R1, R2, R3, R4, R5] =
 1290:         [#hostent{
 1291:             h_name = h_ex(Name),
 1292:             h_aliases = [h_ex(Alias) || Alias <- Aliases],
 1293:             h_addrtype = Fam,
 1294:             h_length =
 1295:                 case Fam of
 1296:                     inet -> 4;
 1297:                     inet6 -> 16
 1298:                 end,
 1299:             h_addr_list =
 1300:                 [case Fam of
 1301:                      inet -> inet_ex(N);
 1302:                      inet6 -> inet6_ex(N)
 1303:                  end]}
 1304:          || {{Fam,N}, Name, Aliases} <-
 1305:                 [{{inet,1}, "a", ["B"]},
 1306:                  {{inet,2}, "D", []},
 1307:                  {{inet6,3}, "A", ["c"]},
 1308:                  {{inet,1}, "c", []},
 1309:                  {{inet,5}, "A", []}]],
 1310:     true = R1#hostent.h_addr_list =:= R4#hostent.h_addr_list,
 1311:     R14 =
 1312:         R1#hostent{
 1313:           h_aliases =
 1314:               R1#hostent.h_aliases ++
 1315:               [R4#hostent.h_name | R4#hostent.h_aliases]},
 1316:     R145 =
 1317:         R14#hostent{
 1318:           h_addr_list =
 1319:               R1#hostent.h_addr_list ++ R5#hostent.h_addr_list},
 1320:     %%
 1321:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1322:     HostsFile = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-quirks.hosts"),
 1323:     InetRc = filename:join(RootDir, "quirks.inetrc"),
 1324:     ok = file:write_file(HostsFile, hostents_to_list(Records)),
 1325:     ok = file:write_file(InetRc, "{hosts_file, \"" ++ HostsFile ++ "\"}.\n"),
 1326:     %%
 1327:     %% start a node
 1328:     {ok, Peer, TestNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel", "inetrc", "\"" ++ InetRc ++ "\""]),
 1329:     %% ensure it has our RC
 1330:     Rc = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, []),
 1331:     {hosts_file, HostsFile} = lists:keyfind(hosts_file, 1, Rc),
 1332:     false = lists:keyfind(host, 1, Rc),
 1333:     %%
 1334:     %% check entries
 1335:     io:format("Check hosts file contents~n", []),
 1336:     V1 =
 1337:       [{R14, inet_ex(1)},
 1338:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1339:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1340:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1341:        {R145, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1342:        {R14, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1343:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1344:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1345:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1346:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1347:       ],
 1348:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1349:     %%
 1350:     %% test add and del
 1351:     A1 = inet_ex(1),
 1352:     Hs1 = [h_ex("a"), h_ex("B")],
 1353:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, add_host, [A1, Hs1]),
 1354:     io:format("Check after add host~n", []),
 1355:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(
 1356:       TestNode,
 1357:       [{R1, A1},
 1358:        {R2, inet_ex(2)},
 1359:        {R3, inet6_ex(3)},
 1360:        {R5, inet_ex(5)},
 1361:        {R1, h_ex("a"), inet},
 1362:        {R1, h_ex("b"), inet},
 1363:        {R14, h_ex("c"), inet},
 1364:        {R2, h_ex("d"), inet},
 1365:        {R3, h_ex("a"), inet6},
 1366:        {R3, h_ex("c"), inet6}
 1367:       ]),
 1368:     {host, A1, Hs1} =
 1369:         lists:keyfind(host, 1, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, get_rc, [])),
 1370:     ok = rpc:call(TestNode, inet_db, del_host, [inet_ex(1)]),
 1371:     io:format("Check after del host~n", []),
 1372:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, V1),
 1373:     %%
 1374:     %% cleanup
 1375:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1376: 
 1377: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs) ->
 1378:     hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, Vs, true).
 1379: %%
 1380: hosts_file_quirks_verify(_TestNode, [], Ok) ->
 1381:     case Ok of
 1382:         true -> ok;
 1383:         false -> error(verify_failed)
 1384:     end;
 1385: hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, [V | Vs], Ok) ->
 1386:     case
 1387:         case V of
 1388:             {R, Addr} ->
 1389:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyaddr, [Addr])};
 1390:             {R, Host, Fam} ->
 1391:                 {R, rpc:call(TestNode, inet_hosts, gethostbyname, [Host, Fam])}
 1392:         end
 1393:     of
 1394:         {nxdomain, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1395:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1396:         {_R_1, {error, nxdomain}} ->
 1397:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: nxdomain~n", [V]),
 1398:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false);
 1399:         {R_1, {ok, R_1}} ->
 1400:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, Ok);
 1401:         {_R_1, {ok, R_2}} ->
 1402:             io:format("Verify failed ~p: ~p~n", [V, R_2]),
 1403:             hosts_file_quirks_verify(TestNode, Vs, false)
 1404:     end.
 1405: 
 1406: %% Expand entry
 1407: h_ex(H) -> H ++ ".example.com".
 1408: inet_ex(N) -> {127,17,17,N}.
 1409: inet6_ex(N) -> {0,0,0,0,17,17,17,N}.
 1410: 
 1411: hostents_to_list([]) -> [];
 1412: hostents_to_list([R | Rs]) ->
 1413:     #hostent{
 1414:        h_name = Name,
 1415:        h_aliases = Aliases,
 1416:        h_addr_list = [IP]} = R,
 1417:     [inet:ntoa(IP), $\t,
 1418:      lists:join($\s, [Name | Aliases]), $\r, $\n
 1419:      | hostents_to_list(Rs)].
 1420: 
 1421: 
 1422: %% These must be run in the whole suite since they need
 1423: %% the host list and require inet_gethost_native to be started.
 1424: %%
 1425: -record(gethostnative_control, {control_seq,
 1426: 				control_interval = 100,
 1427: 				lookup_delay     = 10,
 1428: 				lookup_count     = 300,
 1429: 				lookup_processes = 20}).
 1430: 
 1431: gethostnative_soft_restart() -> required(hosts).
 1432: 
 1433: %% Check that no name lookups fails during soft restart
 1434: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1435: gethostnative_soft_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1436:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1437:                                         [soft_restart]),
 1438:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1439: 
 1440: gethostnative_debug_level() -> required(hosts).
 1441: 
 1442: %% Check that no name lookups fails during debug level change
 1443: %% of inet_gethost_native.
 1444: gethostnative_debug_level(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1445:     Opts  = gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config,
 1446:                                         [{debug_level, 1},
 1447:                                          {debug_level, 0}]),
 1448:     gethostnative_control(Config, Opts).
 1449: 
 1450: gethostnative_adjusted_opts(Config, CtrlSeq) ->
 1451:     Factor = ?config(kernel_factor, Config),
 1452:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(Factor, CtrlSeq).
 1453: 
 1454: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(1, CtrlSeq) ->
 1455:     #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq};
 1456: gethostnative_adjusted_opts2(F, CtrlSeq) ->
 1457:     Opts = #gethostnative_control{control_seq = CtrlSeq},
 1458:     gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(F, Opts).
 1459: 
 1460: gethostnative_adjusted_opts3(
 1461:   F,
 1462:   #gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1463:                          lookup_processes = NProc} = Opts) ->
 1464:     Adjust = fun(X) ->
 1465:                      if
 1466:                          F > 10 ->
 1467:                              X div 4;
 1468:                          F > 5 ->
 1469:                              X div 3;
 1470:                          F > 2 -> 
 1471:                              (2 * X) div 3;
 1472:                          true ->
 1473:                              X
 1474:                      end
 1475:              end,
 1476:     Opts#gethostnative_control{lookup_count     = Adjust(Cnt),
 1477:                                lookup_processes = Adjust(NProc)}.
 1478: 
 1479: 
 1480: gethostnative_control(Config, Opts) ->
 1481:     case inet_db:res_option(lookup) of
 1482: 	[native] ->
 1483: 	    case whereis(inet_gethost_native) of
 1484: 		Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1485: 		    gethostnative_control_1(Config, Opts);
 1486: 		_ ->
 1487: 		    {skipped, "Not running native gethostbyname"}
 1488: 	    end;
 1489: 	_ ->
 1490: 	    {skipped, "Native not only lookup method"}
 1491:     end.
 1492: 
 1493: gethostnative_control_1(
 1494:   Config,
 1495:   #gethostnative_control{control_seq      = Seq,
 1496:                          control_interval = Interval,
 1497:                          lookup_delay     = Delay,
 1498:                          lookup_count     = Cnt,
 1499:                          lookup_processes = N}) ->
 1500:     ?P("gethostnative control -> begin with"
 1501:        "~n      Ctrl Seq:      ~p"
 1502:        "~n      Ctrl interval: ~p"
 1503:        "~n      Lookup delay:  ~p"
 1504:        "~n      Lookup count:  ~p"
 1505:        "~n      Lookup procs:  ~p", [Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N]),
 1506:     {ok, Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1507:     {ok, _}        = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname),
 1508:     Hosts          =
 1509:         [Hostname|[H || {_,H} <- get_hosts(Config)]
 1510:          ++[H++D || H <- ["www.","www1.","www2.",""],
 1511:         	    D <- ["erlang.org","erlang.se"]]
 1512:          ++[H++"cslab.ericsson.net" || H <- ["morgoth.","hades.","styx."]]],
 1513:     ?P("ctrl-1: Hosts: "
 1514:        "~n   ~p", [Hosts]),
 1515:     %% Spawn some processes to do parallel lookups while
 1516:     %% I repeatedly do inet_gethost_native:control/1.
 1517:     TrapExit = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1518:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1519:     erlang:display(first_intermission),
 1520:     ?P("ctrl-1: First intermission: "
 1521:        "~n   Now starting control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1522:     gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1523:     erlang:display(second_intermission),
 1524:     ?P("ctrl-1: Second intermission: "
 1525:        "~n   Now stopping control sequence ~p", [Seq]),
 1526:     gethostnative_control_2([undefined], Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts),
 1527:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, TrapExit),
 1528:     ?P("control-1: done"),
 1529:     ok.
 1530: 
 1531: gethostnative_control_2(Seq, Interval, Delay, Cnt, N, Hosts) ->
 1532:     Tag       = make_ref(),
 1533:     Parent    = self(),
 1534:     Lookup    = fun() ->
 1535:                         ?P("lookuper starting"),
 1536:                         lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) 
 1537:                 end,
 1538:     Lookupers = [spawn_link(Lookup) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1539:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq),
 1540:     gethostnative_control_3(Tag, ok).
 1541: 
 1542: gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Reason) ->
 1543:     receive
 1544: 	{Tag, Lookuper, Error} ->
 1545:             ?P("control-3: received lookup error from ~p: ~p",
 1546:                [Lookuper, Error]),
 1547: 	    gethostnative_control_3(Tag, Error)
 1548:     after 0 ->
 1549:             ?P("control-3: no (more) lookup errors"),
 1550: 	    Reason
 1551:     end.
 1552: 
 1553: control_loop([], _Interval, _Tag, [], _Seq) ->
 1554:     ok;
 1555: control_loop([], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1556:     control_loop(Seq, Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq);
 1557: control_loop([Op|Ops], Interval, Tag, Lookupers, Seq) ->
 1558:     control_loop(Ops, Interval, Tag, 
 1559: 		 control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers),
 1560: 		 Seq).
 1561: 
 1562: control_loop_1(Op, Interval, Tag, Lookupers) ->
 1563:     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: await lookuper exit"),
 1564:     receive
 1565:         {'EXIT', _Pid, {timetrap_timeout, _, _}} ->
 1566:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1567:                "timetrap timeout while ~w lookupers remaining: "
 1568:                "~n   Op:       ~p"
 1569:                "~n   Interval: ~p"
 1570:                "~n   Tag:      ~p",
 1571:                [length(Lookupers), Op, Interval, Tag]),
 1572:             if
 1573:                 (Op =/= undefined) ->
 1574:                     exit({timetrap, {Op, Tag, length(Lookupers)}});
 1575:                 true ->
 1576:                     exit({timetrap, {Tag, length(Lookupers)}})
 1577:             end;
 1578: 
 1579: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
 1580: 	    case Reason of
 1581: 		Tag -> % Done
 1582:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1583:                        "received expected exit from lookuper ~p", [Pid]),
 1584: 		    control_loop_1
 1585: 		      (Op, Interval, Tag,
 1586: 		       lists:delete(Pid, Lookupers));
 1587: 		_ ->
 1588:                     ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1589:                        "received unexpected exit from ~p: "
 1590:                        "~n   ~p", [Pid, Reason]),
 1591: 		    ct:fail(?F("Unexpected exit from ~p", [Pid]))
 1592: 	    end
 1593: 
 1594:     after Interval ->
 1595:             ?P("ctrl-loop-1: "
 1596:                "timeout => (maybe) attempt control ~p when"
 1597:                "~n   Lookupers: ~p", [Op, Lookupers]),
 1598: 	    if Op =/= undefined ->
 1599: 		    ok = inet_gethost_native:control(Op);
 1600: 	       true ->
 1601: 		    ok
 1602: 	    end,
 1603: 	    Lookupers
 1604:     end.
 1605: 
 1606: lookup_loop(_, _Delay, Tag, _Parent,  0, _Hosts) ->
 1607:     ?P("lookup-loop: done with ~p", [Tag]),
 1608:     exit(Tag);
 1609: lookup_loop([], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1610:     ?P("lookup-loop: begin lookup (~p) again when count = ~p", [Tag, Cnt]),
 1611:     lookup_loop(Hosts, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts);
 1612: lookup_loop([H|Hs], Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt, Hosts) ->
 1613:     ?P("lookup-loop: try lookup (~p, ~p) ~p", [Tag, Cnt, H]),
 1614:     case inet:gethostbyname(H) of
 1615: 	{ok, _Hent} ->
 1616:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => found"),
 1617:             ok;
 1618: 	{error, nxdomain} ->
 1619:             ?P("lookup-loop: lookup => nxdomain"),
 1620:             ok;
 1621: 	Error ->
 1622: 	    ?P("loopkup-loop: lookup => error for ~p: ~p", [H, Error]),
 1623: 	    Parent ! {Tag, self(), Error}
 1624:     end,
 1625:     receive
 1626:     after rand:uniform(Delay) ->
 1627: 	    lookup_loop(Hs, Delay, Tag, Parent, Cnt-1, Hosts) 
 1628:     end.
 1629: 
 1630: 
 1631: 
 1632: %% Test lookup with erroneously configured lookup option (OTP-12133).
 1633: lookup_bad_search_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1634:     %% Manipulation of resolver config is done in init_per_testcase
 1635:     %% and end_per_testcase to ensure cleanup.
 1636:     {ok,Hostname} = inet:gethostname(),
 1637:     {ok,_Hent} = inet:gethostbyname(Hostname), % Will hang loop for this bug
 1638:     ok.
 1639: 
 1640: 
 1641: 
 1642: %% Tests basic functionality of getiflist, getif, and ifget.
 1643: getif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1644:     case os:type() of
 1645: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1646: 	    do_getif(Osname, default),
 1647:             do_getif(Osname, inet),
 1648:             do_getif(Osname, socket);
 1649: 	{_,_} ->
 1650: 	    {skip,"inet:getif/0 probably not supported"}
 1651:     end.
 1652: 
 1653: inet_getiflist(default) ->
 1654:     inet:getiflist();
 1655: inet_getiflist(Backend) ->
 1656:     Func = getiflist,
 1657:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1658:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1659: 
 1660: 
 1661: backend_conditional_run(default = Backend, Func, Fun)
 1662:   when is_atom(Func) andalso
 1663:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1664:        io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1665:        Fun();
 1666: backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)
 1667:   when ((Backend =:= inet) orelse (Backend =:= socket)) andalso
 1668:        is_atom(Func) andalso
 1669:        is_function(Fun, 0) ->
 1670:     try is_supported_backend(Backend) of
 1671:         true ->
 1672:             io:format("try '~w' ~w~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1673:             Fun();            
 1674:         false ->
 1675:             io:format("skip '~w' ~w: not supported~n", [Backend, Func]),
 1676:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, notsup}})
 1677:     catch
 1678:         C:E:S ->
 1679:             %% Assume its because we run in a 'noesock' (or similar) system...
 1680:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1681:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1682:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1683:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1684:                       "~n", [Backend, C, E, S]),
 1685:             throw({skip, {Func, Backend, C, E}})
 1686:     end.            
 1687: 
 1688: 
 1689: inet_ifget(default, Name, Opts) ->
 1690:     inet:ifget(Name, Opts);
 1691: inet_ifget(Backend, Name, Opts) ->
 1692:     Func = ifget,
 1693:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func(Name, [{inet_backend, Backend}|Opts]) end,
 1694:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1695: 
 1696: inet_getif(default) ->
 1697:     inet:getif();
 1698: inet_getif(Backend) ->
 1699:     Func = getif,
 1700:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1701:     backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun).
 1702:     
 1703: 
 1704: do_getif(OsName, Backend) ->
 1705:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1706:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1707:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1708:     try do_getif2(OsName, Backend) of
 1709:         ok ->
 1710:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1711:             ok
 1712:     catch
 1713:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1714:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1715:                       "~n   ~p"
 1716:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1717:             ok
 1718:     end.
 1719: 
 1720: do_getif2(OsName, Backend) ->
 1721:     io:format("~w(~w) -> entry with"
 1722:               "~n   OsName:  ~p"
 1723:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, OsName]),
 1724: 
 1725:     %% For this to work with the 'socket' backend, we need to verify 
 1726:     {ok, Hostname}   = inet:gethostname(),
 1727:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1728:               "~n   Hostname: ~p"
 1729:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Hostname]),
 1730:     {ok, Address}    = inet:getaddr(Hostname,    inet),
 1731:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1732:               "~n   Address: ~p"
 1733:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Address]),
 1734:     {ok, Loopback}   = inet:getaddr("localhost", inet),
 1735:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1736:               "~n   Loopback: ~p"
 1737:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Loopback]),
 1738:     {ok, Interfaces} = inet_getiflist(Backend),
 1739:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1740:               "~n   Interfaces: ~p"
 1741:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Interfaces]),
 1742:     HWAs =
 1743:         lists:sort(
 1744:           lists:foldl(
 1745:             fun (I, Acc) ->
 1746:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [hwaddr]) of
 1747:                         {ok,[{hwaddr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1748:                         {ok,[]} -> Acc
 1749:                     end
 1750:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1751:     io:format("~w(~w) -> "
 1752:               "~n   HW Addrs:"
 1753:               "~n      ~p"
 1754:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, HWAs]),
 1755:     (OsName =/= sunos)
 1756:         andalso ((length(HWAs) > 0) orelse (ct:fail(no_HWAs))),
 1757:     Addresses =
 1758:         lists:sort(
 1759:           lists:foldl(
 1760:             fun(I, Acc) ->
 1761:                     case inet_ifget(Backend, I, [addr]) of
 1762:                         {ok, [{addr,A}]} -> [A|Acc];
 1763:                         {ok, []} -> Acc
 1764:                     end
 1765:             end, [], Interfaces)),
 1766:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget result: "
 1767:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1768:               "~n      ~p"
 1769:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1770:     {ok, Getif} = inet_getif(Backend),
 1771:     io:format("~w(~w) -> ifget verify: "
 1772:               "~n   Addresses: "
 1773:               "~n      ~p"
 1774:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Addresses]),
 1775:     Addresses = lists:sort([A || {A,_,_} <- Getif]),
 1776:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify address"
 1777:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1778:     true = ip_member(Address, Addresses),
 1779:     io:format("~w(~w) -> verify loopback"
 1780:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1781:     true = ip_member(Loopback, Addresses),
 1782:     io:format("~w(~w) -> done~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1783:     ok.
 1784: 
 1785: %% Test long interface names do not overrun buffer.
 1786: getif_ifr_name_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1787:     case os:type() of
 1788: 	{unix,Osname} ->
 1789: 	    do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(Osname);
 1790: 	{_,_} ->
 1791: 	    {skip,"inet:ifget/2 probably not supported"}
 1792:     end.
 1793: 
 1794: do_getif_ifr_name_overflow(_) ->
 1795:     %% emulator should not crash
 1796:     {ok,[]} = inet:ifget(lists:duplicate(128, "x"), [addr]),
 1797:     ok.
 1798: 
 1799: %% Test long service names do not overrun buffer.
 1800: getservbyname_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1801:     %% emulator should not crash
 1802:     {error,einval} = inet:getservbyname(list_to_atom(lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(128, "x"))), tcp),
 1803:     ok.
 1804: 
 1805: 
 1806: %% Test inet:gifaddrs/0.
 1807: getifaddrs(Config) when is_list (Config) ->
 1808:     do_getifaddrs(default),
 1809:     do_getifaddrs(inet),
 1810:     do_getifaddrs(socket),
 1811:     getifaddrs_verify_backends().
 1812: 
 1813: do_getifaddrs(Backend) ->
 1814:     try do_getifaddrs2(Backend) of
 1815:         ok ->
 1816:             io:format("~w(~w) -> success~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend]),
 1817:             ok
 1818:     catch
 1819:         throw:{skip, Reason} ->
 1820:             io:format("~w(~w) -> skipping: "
 1821:                       "~n   ~p"
 1822:                       "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Backend, Reason]),
 1823:             ok
 1824:     end.
 1825: 
 1826: 
 1827: do_getifaddrs2(default) ->
 1828:     io:format("try 'default' getifaddrs~n", []),
 1829:     do_getifaddrs3(inet:getifaddrs());
 1830: do_getifaddrs2(Backend) ->
 1831:     Func = getifaddrs,
 1832:     Fun  = fun() -> inet:Func([{inet_backend, Backend}]) end,
 1833:     do_getifaddrs3(backend_conditional_run(Backend, Func, Fun)).
 1834:     
 1835: 
 1836: is_supported_backend(inet = _Backend) ->
 1837:     true;
 1838: is_supported_backend(socket = _Backend) ->
 1839:     is_socket_supported().
 1840: 
 1841: is_socket_supported() ->
 1842:     try socket:info() of
 1843:         #{} ->
 1844:             true
 1845:     catch
 1846:         error : notsup ->
 1847:             false;
 1848:         error : undef ->
 1849:             false
 1850:     end.
 1851: 
 1852:     
 1853: do_getifaddrs3({ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 1854:     io:format("~w(ok) -> IfAddrs: "
 1855:               "~n   ~p"
 1856:               "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, IfAddrs]),
 1857:     case [If || {If,Opts} <- IfAddrs, lists:keymember(hwaddr, 1, Opts)] of
 1858:         [] ->
 1859:             case os:type() of
 1860:                 {unix,sunos} -> ok;
 1861:                 OT ->
 1862:                     ct:fail({should_have_hwaddr,OT})
 1863:             end;
 1864:         [_|_] -> ok
 1865:     end,
 1866:     Addrs = ifaddrs(IfAddrs),
 1867:     io:format("Addrs: "
 1868:               "~n   ~p"
 1869:               "~n", [Addrs]),
 1870:     [check_addr(Addr) || Addr <- Addrs],
 1871:     ok.
 1872: 
 1873: check_addr(Addr)
 1874:   when tuple_size(Addr) =:= 8,
 1875:        element(1, Addr) band 16#FFC0 =:= 16#FE80 ->
 1876:     io:format("Addr: ~p link local; SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1877:     ok;
 1878: check_addr({169, 254, 118, _} = Addr) ->
 1879:     io:format("Addr: ~p reserved (not usable); SKIPPED!~n", [Addr]),
 1880:     ok;
 1881: check_addr(Addr) ->
 1882:     io:format("Addr: ~p.~n", [Addr]),
 1883:     Ping = "ping",
 1884:     Pong = "pong",
 1885:     {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip,Addr},{active,false}]),
 1886:     {ok,P} = inet:port(L),
 1887:     {ok,S1} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, P, [{active,false}]),
 1888:     {ok,S2} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1889:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S2, Ping),
 1890:     {ok,Ping} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, length(Ping)),
 1891:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S1, Pong),
 1892:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 1893:     {ok,Pong} = gen_tcp:recv(S2, length(Pong)),
 1894:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S2),
 1895:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1896: 
 1897: ifaddrs(IfOpts) ->
 1898:     IfMap = collect_ifopts(IfOpts),
 1899:     ChkFun =
 1900:         fun Self({{_,Flags} = Key, Opts}, ok) ->
 1901:                 Broadcast = lists:member(broadcast, Flags),
 1902:                 P2P = lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags),
 1903:                 case Opts of
 1904:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{broadaddr,_}|Os]
 1905:                       when Broadcast ->
 1906:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1907:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_},{dstaddr,_}|Os]
 1908:                       when P2P ->
 1909:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1910:                     [{addr,_},{netmask,_}|Os] ->
 1911:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1912:                     [{hwaddr,_}|Os] ->
 1913:                         Self({Key, Os}, ok);
 1914:                     [] ->
 1915:                         ok
 1916:                 end
 1917:         end,
 1918:     fold_ifopts(ChkFun, ok, IfMap),
 1919:     AddrsFun =
 1920:         fun ({{_,Flags}, Opts}, Acc) ->
 1921:                 case
 1922:                     lists:member(running, Flags)
 1923:                     andalso (not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags))
 1924:                 of
 1925:                     true ->
 1926:                         lists:reverse(
 1927:                           [Addr || {addr,Addr} <- Opts],
 1928:                           Acc);
 1929:                     false ->
 1930:                         Acc
 1931:                 end
 1932:         end,
 1933:     fold_ifopts(AddrsFun, [], IfMap).
 1934: 
 1935: collect_ifopts(IfOpts) ->
 1936:     collect_ifopts(IfOpts, #{}).
 1937: %%
 1938: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap) ->
 1939:     case IfOpts of
 1940:         [{If,[{flags,Flags}|Opts]}|IfOs] ->
 1941:             Key = {If,Flags},
 1942:             case maps:is_key(Key, IfMap) of
 1943:                 true ->
 1944:                     ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap});
 1945:                 false ->
 1946:                     collect_ifopts(IfOs, IfMap, Opts, Key, [])
 1947:             end;
 1948:         [] ->
 1949:             IfMap;
 1950:         _ ->
 1951:             ct:fail({unexpected_ifopts,IfOpts,IfMap})
 1952:     end.
 1953: %%
 1954: collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Opts, Key, R) ->
 1955:     case Opts of
 1956:         [{flags,_}|_] ->
 1957:             {If,_} = Key,
 1958:             collect_ifopts(
 1959:               [{If,Opts}|IfOpts], maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap));
 1960:         [OptVal|Os] ->
 1961:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, IfMap, Os, Key, [OptVal|R]);
 1962:         [] ->
 1963:             collect_ifopts(IfOpts, maps:put(Key, lists:reverse(R), IfMap))
 1964:     end.
 1965: 
 1966: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap) ->
 1967:     fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, maps:keys(IfMap)).
 1968: %%
 1969: fold_ifopts(Fun, Acc, IfMap, Keys) ->
 1970:     case Keys of
 1971:         [Key|Ks] ->
 1972:             Opts = maps:get(Key, IfMap),
 1973:             fold_ifopts(Fun, Fun({Key,Opts}, Acc), IfMap, Ks);
 1974:         [] ->
 1975:             Acc
 1976:     end.
 1977: 
 1978: 
 1979: getifaddrs_verify_backends() ->
 1980:     io:format("maybe attempt verify backends~n", []),
 1981:     try is_supported_backend(inet) of
 1982:         true ->
 1983:             try is_supported_backend(socket) of
 1984:                 true ->
 1985:                     getifaddrs_verify_backends(
 1986:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, inet}]),
 1987:                       inet:getifaddrs([{inet_backend, socket}]));
 1988:                 false ->
 1989:                     io:format("'socket' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 1990:             catch
 1991:                 SC:SE:SS ->
 1992:                     io:format("skipping ~p: "
 1993:                               "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 1994:                               "~n   Error:         ~p"
 1995:                               "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 1996:                               "~n", [socket, SC, SE, SS]),
 1997:                     ok
 1998:             end;
 1999:         false ->
 2000:             io:format("'inet' backend not supported: skip~n", [])
 2001:     catch
 2002:         IC:IE:IS ->
 2003:             io:format("skipping ~p: "
 2004:                       "~n   (Error) Class: ~p"
 2005:                       "~n   Error:         ~p"
 2006:                       "~n   Stack:         ~p"
 2007:                       "~n", [inet, IC, IE, IS]),
 2008:             ok
 2009:     end.
 2010: 
 2011: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs},
 2012:                            {ok, IfAddrs}) ->
 2013:     io:format("IfAddrs are equal: "
 2014:               "~n   ~p"
 2015:               "~n", [IfAddrs]),
 2016:     ok;
 2017: getifaddrs_verify_backends({ok, IfAddrs_INET},
 2018:                            {ok, IfAddrs_SOCKET}) ->
 2019:     io:format("IfAddrs are not *identical* - check what differs: "
 2020:               "~n   INET:"
 2021:               "~n      ~p"
 2022:               "~n   SOCKET:"
 2023:               "~n      ~p"
 2024:               "~n   INET -- SOCKET: "
 2025:               "~n      ~p"
 2026:               "~n   SOCKET -- INET: "
 2027:               "~n      ~p"
 2028:               "~n", [IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2029:                      IfAddrs_INET -- IfAddrs_SOCKET,
 2030:                      IfAddrs_SOCKET -- IfAddrs_INET]),
 2031:     getifaddrs_verify_backends2(IfAddrs_INET, IfAddrs_SOCKET).
 2032: 
 2033: getifaddrs_verify_backends2(INET, SOCKET) ->
 2034:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(lists:keysort(1, INET),
 2035:                                 lists:keysort(1, SOCKET)).
 2036: 
 2037: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2038:     ok;
 2039: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([] = _INET, SOCKET) ->
 2040:     io:format("'socket' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2041:               "~n   ~p"
 2042:               "~n", [SOCKET]),
 2043:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2044: getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, [] = _SOCKET) ->
 2045:     io:format("'inet' backend contains extra interfaces: "
 2046:               "~n   ~p"
 2047:               "~n", [INET]),
 2048:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2049: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, INFO}|INET],
 2050:                             [{IF, INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2051:     io:format("backend(s) identical for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2052:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2053: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{IF, I_INFO}|INET],
 2054:                             [{IF, S_INFO}|SOCKET]) ->
 2055:     io:format("backend(s) not *identical* for ~p~n", [IF]),
 2056:     getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO),
 2057:     getifaddrs_verify_backends3(INET, SOCKET);
 2058: getifaddrs_verify_backends3([{I_IF, _}|_], [{S_IF, _}|_]) ->
 2059:     io:format("not equal interfaces"
 2060:               "~n   ~p"
 2061:               "~n   ~p"
 2062:               "~n", [I_IF, S_IF]),
 2063:     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal).
 2064: 
 2065: 
 2066: %% On windows the info may be in different order
 2067: %% (inet and net versions) because the information
 2068: %% comes from several sources. And the processing
 2069: %% is different on inet and net.
 2070: %% The info always starts with 'flags' and ends with
 2071: %% 'hwaddr'. So deal with those two first and the rest
 2072: %% can compared after.
 2073: 
 2074: getifaddrs_verify_backend(IF, I_INFO, S_INFO) ->
 2075:     {I_Rest1, S_Rest1} =
 2076:         case {I_INFO, S_INFO} of
 2077:             {[{flags, I_FLAGS}|IR1], [{flags, S_FLAGS}|SR1]} ->
 2078:                 case {I_FLAGS -- S_FLAGS, S_FLAGS -- I_FLAGS} of
 2079:                     {[], []} ->
 2080:                         io:format("flags for ~p *are* equal~n", [IF]),
 2081:                         {IR1, SR1};
 2082:                     {[], [multicast]} ->
 2083:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2084:                                   "extra flag 'multicast': "
 2085:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2086:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2087:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2088:                         case lists:member(loopback, I_FLAGS) of
 2089:                             true ->
 2090:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2091:                                 %% some more flags...
 2092:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2093:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2094:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2095:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2096:                             _ ->
 2097:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2098:                         end;
 2099:                     {[], [running]} ->
 2100:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - "
 2101:                                   "extra flag 'running': "
 2102:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2103:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2104:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS]),
 2105:                         case lists:member(up, I_FLAGS) of
 2106:                             true ->
 2107:                                 %% The net module getifaddrs contains
 2108:                                 %% some more flags...
 2109:                                 %% Happens on windows
 2110:                                 io:format("flags for ~p *acceptably* "
 2111:                                           "different~n", [IF]),
 2112:                                 {IR1, SR1};
 2113:                             _ ->
 2114:                                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2115:                         end;
 2116:                     {IRem, SRem} ->
 2117:                         io:format("flags for ~p are *not* equal - check flags: "
 2118:                                   "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2119:                                   "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2120:                                   "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2121:                                   "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2122:                                   "~n", [IF, I_FLAGS, S_FLAGS, IRem, SRem]),
 2123:                         ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2124:                 end;
 2125:             _ ->
 2126:                 io:format("flags for ~p missing for one or both backends: "
 2127:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2128:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2129:                           "~n", [IF, I_INFO, S_INFO]),
 2130:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2131:         end,
 2132:     {I_Rest2, S_Rest2} =
 2133:         case {lists:reverse(I_Rest1), lists:reverse(S_Rest1)} of
 2134:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|IR2], [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2135:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *is* equal~n", [IF]),
 2136:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2137:             {[{hwaddr, I_HWADDR}|_IR2], [{hwaddr, S_HWADDR}|_SR2]} ->
 2138:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p *not* equal:"
 2139:                           "~n   INET:   ~p"
 2140:                           "~n   SOCKET: ~p"
 2141:                           "~n", [IF, I_HWADDR, S_HWADDR]),
 2142:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2143:             {IR2, [{hwaddr, HWADDR}|SR2]} ->
 2144:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for socket - accept: "
 2145:                           "~n   ~p"
 2146:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2147:                 {lists:reverse(IR2), lists:reverse(SR2)};
 2148:             {[{hwaddr, HWADDR}|_IR2], _SR2} ->
 2149:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p only for inet - fail: "
 2150:                           "~n   ~p"
 2151:                           "~n", [IF, HWADDR]),
 2152:                 ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal);
 2153:             _ ->
 2154:                 io:format("hwaddr for ~p missing for both backends - accept~n",
 2155:                           [IF]),
 2156:                 {I_Rest1, S_Rest1}
 2157:         end,
 2158:     case {I_Rest2 -- S_Rest2, S_Rest2 -- I_Rest2} of
 2159:         {[], []} ->
 2160:             io:format("remaining info for ~p is equal~n", [IF]),
 2161:             ok;
 2162:         {I_Diff, S_Diff} ->
 2163:             io:format("remaining info for ~p not equal: "
 2164:                       "~n   INET:           ~p"
 2165:                       "~n   SOCKET:         ~p"
 2166:                       "~n   INET -- SOCKET: ~p"
 2167:                       "~n   SOCKET -- INET: ~p"
 2168:                       "~n", [IF, I_Rest2, S_Rest2, I_Diff, S_Diff]),
 2169:             %% Check if its a link local address, then ignore...
 2170:             %% This is "a bit" loosey-goosey...
 2171:             case lists:keysearch(addr, 1, S_Rest2) of
 2172:                 {value, {addr, {169, 254, _, _}}} ->
 2173:                     io:format("link local address for ~p - accept~n", [IF]),
 2174:                     ok;
 2175:                 _ ->
 2176:                     ct:fail(ifaddrs_not_equal)
 2177:             end
 2178:     end.
 2179: 
 2180: 
 2181: %% Works just like lists:member/2, except that any {127,_,_,_} tuple
 2182: %% matches any other {127,_,_,_}. We do this to handle Linux systems
 2183: %% that use (for instance) 127.0.1.1 as the IP address for the hostname.
 2184: 
 2185: ip_member({127,_,_,_}, [{127,_,_,_}|_]) -> true;
 2186: ip_member(K, [K|_]) -> true;
 2187: ip_member(K, [_|T]) -> ip_member(K, T);
 2188: ip_member(_, []) -> false.
 2189: 
 2190: %% Case fold to upper case according to RFC 4343
 2191: %%
 2192: toupper([C|Cs]) when is_integer(C) ->
 2193:     if  $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 2194: 	    [(C - $a + $A)|toupper(Cs)];
 2195: 	true ->
 2196: 	    [C|toupper(Cs)]
 2197:     end;
 2198: toupper([]) ->
 2199:     [].
 2200: 
 2201: 
 2202: simple_netns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2203:     {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2204:     case inet:setopts(U, [{netns,""}]) of
 2205: 	ok ->
 2206: 	    jog_netns_opt(U),
 2207: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2208: 	    %%
 2209: 	    {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2210: 	    jog_netns_opt(L),
 2211: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2212: 	    %%
 2213: 	    case gen_sctp:open() of
 2214: 		{ok,S} ->
 2215: 		    jog_netns_opt(S),
 2216: 		    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2217: 		{error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2218: 		    ok
 2219: 	    end;
 2220: 	{error,einval} ->
 2221: 	    {skip,"setns() not supported"}
 2222:     end.
 2223: 
 2224: jog_netns_opt(S) ->
 2225:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2226:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,""}]),
 2227:     {ok,[{netns,""}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2228:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]),
 2229:     {ok,[{netns,"/proc/self/ns/net"}]} = inet:getopts(S, [netns]),
 2230:     ok.
 2231: 
 2232: 
 2233: %% Smoke test netns support.
 2234: simple_netns_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2235:     %% Note: {error,enoent} will be returned if the run-time executable
 2236:     %%       has support for netns, but /proc/self/ns/net is missing.
 2237:     case gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2238: 	{ok,U} ->
 2239: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(U);
 2240: 	{error,E1} when E1 =:= einval; E1 =:= eperm; E1 =:= enoent ->
 2241: 	    ok
 2242:     end,
 2243:     case gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2244: 	{ok,T} ->
 2245: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(T);
 2246: 	{error,E2} when E2 =:= einval; E2 =:= eperm; E2 =:= enoent ->
 2247: 	    ok
 2248:     end,
 2249:     try gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{netns,"/"},inet]) of
 2250: 	{ok,S} ->
 2251: 	    ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2252: 	{error,E3}
 2253: 	  when E3 =:= einval; E3 =:= eperm;
 2254: 	       E3 =:= enoent; E3 =:= eprotonosupport ->
 2255: 	    ok
 2256:     catch
 2257: 	error:badarg ->
 2258: 	    %% Some older platforms does not allow netns for sctp
 2259: 	    ok
 2260:     end.
 2261: 
 2262: 
 2263: %% Manual test to be run outside test_server in an emulator
 2264: %% started by root, in a machine with setns() support...
 2265: test_netns() ->
 2266:     DefaultIF = v1,
 2267:     DefaultIP = {192,168,1,17},
 2268:     Namespace = "test",
 2269:     NamespaceIF = v2,
 2270:     NamespaceIP = {192,168,1,18},
 2271:     %%
 2272:     DefaultIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(DefaultIP),
 2273:     NamespaceIPString = inet_parse:ntoa(NamespaceIP),
 2274:     cmd("ip netns add ~s",
 2275: 	[Namespace]),
 2276:     cmd("ip link add name ~w type veth peer name ~w netns ~s",
 2277:         [DefaultIF,NamespaceIF,Namespace]),
 2278:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2279: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIPString,NamespaceIF]),
 2280:     cmd("ip netns exec ~s ip link set ~w up",
 2281: 	[Namespace,NamespaceIF]),
 2282:     cmd("ip addr add ~s/30 dev ~w",
 2283: 	[DefaultIPString,DefaultIF]),
 2284:     cmd("ip link set ~w up",
 2285: 	[DefaultIF]),
 2286:     try test_netns(
 2287: 	  {DefaultIF,DefaultIP},
 2288: 	  filename:join("/var/run/netns/", Namespace),
 2289: 	  {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) of
 2290: 	Result ->
 2291: 	    io:put_chars(["#### Test done",io_lib:nl()]),
 2292: 	    Result
 2293:     after
 2294: 	cmd("ip link delete ~w type veth",
 2295: 	    [DefaultIF]),
 2296: 	cmd("ip netns delete ~s",
 2297: 	    [Namespace])
 2298:     end.
 2299: 
 2300: test_netns({DefaultIF,DefaultIP}, Namespace, {NamespaceIF,NamespaceIP}) ->
 2301:     {ok,ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 2302:     {ok,[{addr,DefaultIP}]} = inet:ifget(ListenSocket, DefaultIF, [addr]),
 2303:     {ok,ListenPort} = inet:port(ListenSocket),
 2304:     {ok,ConnectSocket} =
 2305: 	gen_tcp:connect(
 2306: 	  DefaultIP, ListenPort, [{active,false},{netns,Namespace}], 3000),
 2307:     {ok,[{addr,NamespaceIP}]} = inet:ifget(ConnectSocket, NamespaceIF, [addr]),
 2308:     {ok,ConnectPort} = inet:port(ConnectSocket),
 2309:     {ok,AcceptSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket, 0),
 2310:     {ok,AcceptPort} = inet:port(AcceptSocket),
 2311:     {ok,{NamespaceIP,ConnectPort}} = inet:peername(AcceptSocket),
 2312:     {ok,{DefaultIP,AcceptPort}} = inet:peername(ConnectSocket),
 2313:     ok = gen_tcp:send(ConnectSocket, "data"),
 2314:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ConnectSocket),
 2315:     {ok,"data"} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 4, 1000),
 2316:     {error,closed} = gen_tcp:recv(AcceptSocket, 1, 1000),
 2317:     ok = gen_tcp:close(AcceptSocket),
 2318:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket).
 2319: 
 2320: cmd(Cmd, Args) ->
 2321:     cmd(io_lib:format(Cmd, Args)).
 2322: %%
 2323: cmd(CmdString) ->
 2324:     io:put_chars(["# ",CmdString,io_lib:nl()]),
 2325:     io:put_chars([os:cmd(CmdString++" ; echo '  =>' $?")]),
 2326:     ok.
 2327: 
 2328: -define(CAP_NET_RAW, 13).        %% from /usr/include/linux/capability.h
 2329: 
 2330: can_bind_to_device({unix, linux}, {Major, _, _})
 2331:   when Major > 2 ->
 2332:     Status = os:cmd("cat /proc/self/status | grep CapEff"),
 2333:     [_, CapEffStr] = string:tokens(Status, [$\n, $\t]),
 2334:     CapEff = list_to_integer(CapEffStr, 16),
 2335:     if CapEff band (1 bsl ?CAP_NET_RAW) =/= 0 ->
 2336:             ok;
 2337:        true ->
 2338:             {skip,"insufficient capabilities, CAP_NET_RAW not granted"}
 2339:     end;
 2340: can_bind_to_device(_OS, _Version) ->
 2341:     {skip,"socket option bind_to_device not supported on this OS or version"}.
 2342: 
 2343: simple_bind_to_device(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2344:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2345:         ok ->
 2346:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0),
 2347:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(U),
 2348:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2349:             %%
 2350:             {ok,L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
 2351:             jog_bind_to_device_opt(L),
 2352:             ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2353:             %%
 2354:             case gen_sctp:open() of
 2355:                 {ok,S} ->
 2356:                     jog_bind_to_device_opt(S),
 2357:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2358:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2359:                     ok
 2360:             end;
 2361:         Other ->
 2362:             Other
 2363:     end.
 2364: 
 2365: %% Smoke test bind_to_device support.
 2366: simple_bind_to_device_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2367:     case can_bind_to_device(os:type(), os:version()) of
 2368:         ok ->
 2369:             {ok,U} = gen_udp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2370:             ok = gen_udp:close(U),
 2371:             {ok,T} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]),
 2372:             ok = gen_tcp:close(T),
 2373: 
 2374:             case gen_sctp:open(0, [binary,{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>},inet]) of
 2375:                 {ok,S} ->
 2376:                     ok = gen_sctp:close(S);
 2377:                 {error,eprotonosupport} ->
 2378:                     ok
 2379:             end;
 2380:         Other ->
 2381:             Other
 2382:     end.
 2383: 
 2384: jog_bind_to_device_opt(S) ->
 2385:     %% This is just jogging the option mechanics
 2386:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<>>}]),
 2387:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<>>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2388:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]),
 2389:     {ok,[{bind_to_device,<<"lo">>}]} = inet:getopts(S, [bind_to_device]),
 2390:     ok.
 2391: 
 2392: add_del_host(_Config) ->
 2393:     Name = "foo.com",
 2394:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2395:     Ip = {69,89,31,226},
 2396:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2397:         h_name = Name,
 2398:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2399:         h_addrtype = inet,
 2400:         h_length = 4,
 2401:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2402:     },
 2403:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2404:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2405:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2406:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2407:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2408:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet),
 2409:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet),
 2410:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2411:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet).
 2412: 
 2413: add_del_host_v6(_Config) ->
 2414:     Name = "foo.com",
 2415:     Alias = "bar.org",
 2416:     Ip = {32,1,219,8,10,11,18,240},
 2417:     HostEnt = #hostent{
 2418:         h_name = Name,
 2419:         h_aliases = [Alias],
 2420:         h_addrtype = inet6,
 2421:         h_length = 16,
 2422:         h_addr_list = [Ip]
 2423:     },
 2424:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2425:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2426:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2427:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2428:     ok = inet_db:del_host(Ip),
 2429:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6),
 2430:     {error, nxdomain} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Alias, inet6),
 2431:     ok = inet_db:add_host(Ip, [Name, Alias]),
 2432:     {ok, HostEnt} = inet_hosts:gethostbyname(Name, inet6).
 2433: 
 2434: 
 2435: 
 2436: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2437: 
 2438: %%% This is a supremely simple test case.
 2439: %%% It basically just tests that the function (inet:socknames/1,2)
 2440: %%% returns with the expected result (a list of addresses, which in
 2441: %%% the case of tcp and udp should be exactly one address long).
 2442: 
 2443: socknames_sctp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2444:     %%% ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_socknames_sctp(Config) end).
 2445:     {skip, not_implemented_yet}.
 2446: 
 2447: 
 2448: socknames_tcp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2449:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2450:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2451:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2452:                             Addr;
 2453:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2454:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2455:                     end
 2456:            end,
 2457:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_tcp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2458:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2459:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2460: 
 2461: do_socknames_tcp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2462:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2463:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2464:     do_socknames_tcp1([], Addr),
 2465: 
 2466:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2467:     try socket:info() of
 2468:         #{} ->
 2469:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2470:             do_socknames_tcp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2471:     catch
 2472:         error:notsup ->
 2473:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2474:             ok;
 2475:         error:undef:ST ->
 2476:             case ST of
 2477:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2478:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2479:             end
 2480:     end.
 2481: 
 2482: 
 2483: do_socknames_tcp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2484:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2485:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2486:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2487: 
 2488:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 2489:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:listen(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2490:     ?P("try get socknames for (listen) socket: "
 2491:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2492:     PortNumber1 = case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2493: 		      {ok, [{_Addr1, PortNo1}]} ->
 2494: 			  PortNo1;
 2495: 		      {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2496:                           ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2497:                              "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2498: 			  exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2499: 		      {error, Reason1} ->
 2500:                           ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2501:                              "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2502: 			  exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2503: 		  end,
 2504:     ?P("try connect to listen socket on port ~p", [PortNumber1]),
 2505:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNumber1, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2506:     ?P("try get socknames for (connected) socket: "
 2507:        "~n      ~p", [S2]),
 2508:     case inet:socknames(S2) of
 2509: 	{ok, [_Addr2]} ->
 2510: 	    ok;
 2511: 	{ok, Addrs2} ->
 2512:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2513:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs2]),
 2514: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs2)});
 2515: 	{error, Reason2} ->
 2516:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2517:                "~n      ~p", [Reason2]),
 2518: 	    exit({skip, {connected_socket, Reason2}})
 2519:     end,
 2520:     ?P("try accept connection"),
 2521:     {ok, S3} = gen_tcp:accept(S1),
 2522:     ?P("try get socknames for (accepted) socket: "
 2523:        "~n      ~p", [S3]),
 2524:     case inet:socknames(S3) of
 2525: 	{ok, [_Addr3]} ->
 2526: 	    ok;
 2527: 	{ok, Addrs3} ->
 2528:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2529:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs3]),
 2530: 	    exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs3)});
 2531: 	{error, Reason3} ->
 2532:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2533:                "~n      ~p", [Reason3]),
 2534: 	    exit({skip, {accepted_socket, Reason3}})
 2535:     end,
 2536:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2537:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S3)),
 2538:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S2)),
 2539:     (catch gen_tcp:close(S1)),
 2540:     ?P("done"),
 2541:     ok.
 2542: 
 2543: 
 2544: socknames_udp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2545:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2546:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2547:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2548:                             Addr;
 2549:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2550:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2551:                     end
 2552:            end,
 2553:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socknames_udp0(Config, Addr) end,
 2554:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2555:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2556: 
 2557: do_socknames_udp0(_Config, Addr) ->
 2558:     %% Begin with a the plain old boring (= port) socket(s)
 2559:     ?P("Test socknames for 'old' socket (=port)"),
 2560:     do_socknames_udp1([], Addr),
 2561: 
 2562:     %% And *maybe* also check the 'new' shiny socket sockets
 2563:     try socket:info() of
 2564:         #{} ->
 2565:             ?P("Test socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2566:             do_socknames_udp1([{inet_backend, socket}], Addr)
 2567:     catch
 2568:         error : notsup ->
 2569:             ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)"),
 2570:             ok;
 2571:         error:undef:ST ->
 2572:             case ST of
 2573:                 [{prim_socket,info,[],_}|_] ->
 2574:                     ?P("Skip test of socknames for 'new' socket (=socket nif)")
 2575:             end
 2576:     end.
 2577: 
 2578: 
 2579: do_socknames_udp1(Conf, Addr) ->
 2580:     %% For socket on windows, we require binding...
 2581:     ?P("try to bind to ~p", [Addr]),
 2582:     BaseOpts = [{ip, Addr}],
 2583: 
 2584:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2585:     {ok, S1} = gen_udp:open(0, Conf ++ BaseOpts),
 2586:     ?P("try get socknames for socket: "
 2587:        "~n      ~p", [S1]),
 2588:     case inet:socknames(S1) of
 2589:         {ok, [_Addr1]} ->
 2590:             ok;
 2591:         {ok, Addrs1} ->
 2592:             ?P("failed socknames: unexpected number of addresses"
 2593:                "~n      ~p", [Addrs1]),
 2594:             exit({unexpected_addrs_length, length(Addrs1)});
 2595:         {error, Reason1} ->
 2596:             ?P("failed socknames: error"
 2597:                "~n      ~p", [Reason1]),
 2598:             exit({skip, {listen_socket, Reason1}})
 2599:     end,
 2600:     ?P("enable debug"),
 2601:     inet:setopts(S1, [{debug, true}]),
 2602:     ?P("close socket"),
 2603:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 2604:     ?P("done"),
 2605:     ok.
 2606: 
 2607:

 2610: 
 2611: links() ->
 2612:     pi(links).
 2613: 
 2614: monitors() ->
 2615:     pi(monitors).
 2616: 
 2617: pi(Item) ->
 2618:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 2619:     Val.
 2620:     
 2621:
